name: ECA Attraction Theme
desc: The song from the cutscene from the attraction mode of the 1999 Sega arcade game Emergency Call Ambulance.

name: Wings of Courage
origin: Ao no Kanata no Four Rhythm
desc: The song from the opening for Sprite's visual novel Aokana: Four Rhythms Across the Blue.

name: 未来行き☆列車 / Train☆to the Future
desc: The opening for the grand route of Lose's 2016 visual novel Maitetsu.

name: Main Theme (Emergency 4)
desc: The main menu theme from Sixteen Tons Entertainment's video game Emergency 4: Global Fighters for Life.

name: Hot Chocolate
desc: The song sung during the hot chocolate scene from the 2004 film The Polar Express.

name: Joint Reasoning: The Great Deduction (Type A)
desc: One of the three types of the song Joint Reasoning: The Great Deduction from Capcom's 2017 game The Great Ace Attorney.

name: Light
origin: Lucy - The Eternity She Wished For -
desc: The special main menu music for M-Vizlab's 2016 visual novel Lucy - The Eternity She Wished For - that plays once the true ending is viewed.

name: Speed of Light
desc: The song from Hypergryph and Yostar's promotional video for the Code of Brawl event for Hypergryph's 2019 mobile tower defense gacha game Arknights.

name: Motteke! Sailor Fuku
desc: The opening theme song for Kyoto Animation's 2007 anime adaptation of Kagami Yoshimizu's comic strip Lucky Star.

name: ロオド・ラスト / Last Road
desc: The theme from the opening trailer for Lose's 2020 visual novel Maitetsu - Last Run!!.

name: Perplex Express
desc: The background music from the board Shy Guy's Perplex Express from the 2007 video game Mario Party 8.

name: Great Big Rollin' Railroad
desc: A song by C. W. McCall created for use in an advertising campaign by the UPRR in 1970.

name: レイル・ロマネスク / Rail Romanesque
desc: The main theme for Lose's 2016 visual novel Maitetsu, played during the opening for Hachiroku's route and the trailer.

name: Great at Crime
desc: The ending credits theme song for the first several episodes of Brendan "JelloApocalypse" Blaber's miniseries Epithet Erased.

name: Crossing Way
origin: Ao no Kanata no Four Rhythm
desc: The song played during the grand opening for Sprite's visual novel Aokana: Four Rhythms Across the Blue.

name: DEADLINE
desc: The opening theme song for Brendan "JelloApocalypse" Blaber's miniseries Epithet Erased.

name: My Place
desc: The leitmotif for Natsume Rindou, a character from Lump of Sugar's 2010 visual novel Hello, Good-bye.

name: IndEC
desc: One of the background music tracks from Civ3 that plays while your civilization is in the Industrial Era.

name: 名も無き物語 / Nameless Story
desc: The full/extended version of the title screen song from Lump of Sugar's 2010 visual novel Hello, Good-bye.
